thread.title: Tusculum upsets No. 23 Wingate, 26-17 - News Sentinel
thread.title_full: Tusculum upsets No. 23 Wingate, 26-17 - News Sentinel Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Tusculum upsets No. 23 Wingate, 26-17 - News Sentinel
text:
Isaac Robinson rushed for 195 yards and a touchdown to lead Tusculum to a 26-17 upset over No. 23 Wingate University Saturday afternoon at Pioneer Field on homecoming.
Tusculum (3-3, 2-2 South Atlantic Conference) defeated a ranked opponent for the first time since 2008 when the Pioneers defeated then-No. 15 Carson-Newman 45-44 also in Greeneville.
Tusculum had 511 yards of total offense (268 passing, 243 rushing) against the Bulldogs (5-1, 2-1), who entered the game as Division II's top scoring defense (5.6 points per game) and No. 4 in total defense (196 yards per game).
Tusculum's defense also limited Wingate to 248 yards. Running back Lawrence Pittman, who is second in the league in rushing, was held to 82 yards.
Robinson, who established a school single-game record with 250 rushing yards in last week's win at Brevard College, finished with the ninth-best rushing performance in Tusculum history. Robinson averaged seven yards per carry on his 28 attempts.
Robinson also had a 16-yard reception to finish with more than 200 all-purpose yards for a second straight game.
Sophomore quarterback Luke Lancaster passed for 268 yards and three touchdowns for the Pioneers. He added 16 yards on four carries.
Senior Justin Houston was Lancaster's favorite target with a game-high eight receptions for 44 yards and two touchdowns.
Senior linebacker Quez Gaines led the Pioneers in tackling for a second consecutive game as he totaled nine stops, including two behind the line of scrimmage.
